specialist 3/4 a summary of vce specialist 3/4 by briano
1 functions and graphs 1.1 modulus function 1.2 conic sections 1.3 inverse circular functions 1.4 parametric equations

1 functions and graphs 1.1 modulus function \[|f(x)|=\begin{cases} -f(x) & ,f(x)\lt{}0 \\ f(x) & ,f(x)\geq{}0 \end{cases}\] it can also be represented as \(|x|=\sqrt{x^2}\) 1.2 conic sections 1.2.1 circle \[(x-h)^2+(y-k)^2=r^2\] circle with center \((h,k)\) and radius \(r\) 1.2.2 ellipses \[(\frac{x-h}{a})^2+(\frac{y-k}{b})^2=1\] ellipse with center \((h,k)\), width \(2a\) and height \(2b\) 1.2.3 hyperbolas \[(\frac{x-h}{a})^2-(\frac{y-k}{b})^2=1\] \[-(\frac{x-h}{a})^2+(\frac{y-k}{b})^2=1\] asymptotes: \(y=\pm\frac{b}{a}(x-h)+k\) 1.3 inverse circular functions function domain range \(\arcsin(x)\) \([0,1]\) \([-\frac{\pi}{2},\frac{\pi}{2}]\) \(\arccos(x)\) \([0,1]\) \([0,\pi]\) \(\arctan(x)\) \([-\infty,\infty]\) \([-\frac{\pi}{2},\frac{\pi}{2}]\) 1.4 parametric equations \[x=f(t)\] \[y=g(t)\] use simultaneous equation to solve parametric equations
4 calculus 4.0.1 euler’s method euler’s method is used to estimate a function if gradient function is known \[\text{euler}(f'(x),x,y,x_0,x_f)\]
